TopicTitle: LLL - Lack Luster Labs - Development Thread

Articles.Content: Would you make a kethane converter for this pack? The standard one does not fit the 2x1 parts.

Hey Lack, how regularly do you update the main download? Is it every time you make a new part, or do you wait for them to build up?

Either way something that might save you some time is if you get a drop-box account, and then just add new parts and bits to the same archive it will update the archive but keep the same link. So when you made a new engine you could just add it to the main archive and it will just upload that as the new version and all links will still work.

It is excessive to do that for individual part additions, but it could save you some steps with packaging and uploading for the main file.

Would you make a kethane converter for this pack? The standard one does not fit the 2x1 parts.

What are you looking for? Just something about the size of the SAS or maybe even just a Kethane tank that works as a converter?
Could we have a Space Port download? My network blocks most file share sites and I'm not able to use anything else at the moment.
Please PLEASE PLEASE tell me you have that as a ready made ship saved somewhere!!! ~<3
I have a special copy of KSP just for that thing since I needed Hyperedit to get it up there.
*is now weeping in a corner*

Here you go Lack. The screenshots you requested:

http://imgur.com/a/DFQre
i know that bug, it always happens with non-cylindrical parts

Shadow, try turning off angle snap in the VAB. You won't get as exact placement, but I think they should lay flush then (or that's been the case for me previously with non cylindrical parts). Regardless, as the parts are only bilaterally symmetrical, you'll also probably have to only use up to 2x symmetry.

Hey Lack, how regularly do you update the main download? Is it every time you make a new part, or do you wait for them to build up?

Either way something that might save you some time is if you get a drop-box account, and then just add new parts and bits to the same archive it will update the archive but keep the same link. So when you made a new engine you could just add it to the main archive and it will just upload that as the new version and all links will still work.

It is excessive to do that for individual part additions, but it could save you some steps with packaging and uploading for the main file.

What are you looking for? Just something about the size of the SAS or maybe even just a Kethane tank that works as a converter?

Ideally something the size of the SAS tank.
Thanks to Lack Luster Labs, I made The Munolith Hotel and Casino.

Ideally something the size of the SAS tank.

Here you go:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/wk9ndngsi5cjt3u/LLL2x1Kethane%20Converter.rar

I basically just copied the stats for the heavy converter. This one really should have about half the capacity, but meh.

Do something that's obvious and makes things easier to use? Why on earth would anyone want to do something like that?

(Thanks, I do occasionally need a prod in the right direction with these things. I've updated the first post with current downloads, at least till I repackage the lot).

In the mean time: I didn't quite think my duna base/rover through, i.e. I ended up landing with the rover still attached. Worked out in the end, I could drive over for a better view.

Full album

What's the config you have on those B9 landing legs?

What's the config you have on those B9 landing legs?

Changed the rescaleFactor to 0.45 and the weight appropriately. I did the same with the underside legs (except used rescaleFactor = 0.7). That way they fit the sides quite nicely.

I've got a few parts done now, including some more adaptor plates. I'll see about uploading them later.

(The Truss is from Semni's Tri-Hexagonal Structural Strut pack)

I've got a few parts done now, including some more adaptor plates. I'll see about uploading them later.

Great !

Now I just have to push F5 every 30s

So how long before 0.1 comes with all the 0.095 parts, the new textured adaptors, new engines, vtol engines, and hog parts, oh, and those 2 cool new adaptors in the screenshot there.

The pressure is on Lack! Time for 0.1.

Great !

Now I just have to push F5 every 30s

Heh, when I say 'later' I mean either tonight or tomorrow. I had a bit to drink last night and I'm worried that I don't appear to have a hang-over this morning, in my experience that's the calm before the storm.

The pressure is on Lack! Time for 0.1.

In latest new, the 0.1 release is cancelled. Or, more precisely, will be renamed to '0.1b', '0.11', 'Edition 2' or 'Rowan Atkinson in a Kilt', primarily because version names are complete arbitrary

In all seriousness, I'd been wanting to get a few parts polished before I called it that, so there's a bit more bug hunting to do. That's time consuming, so mainly gets done on the weekends.

Edited May 5, 2013 by Lack
Tea and biscuits
Take all the time you need, my F5 key can withstand a week or two of refreshing

The webserver doesn't care about the durability of your keyboard when detecting denial of service though

I think Damion or Skunky once said on IRC that they actually had this exact problem with people who wanted to be the first to get the latest update...

Edit: Wow just noticed that it killed the alpha channel of my avatar in here too... Why does this always have to happen, gah
I use the subscribe to thread to look for news, the F5 spam is virtual

This has to be my favorite pack. I use it along with Mechjeb and KSPX for my stock-ish install. Why not make your own rover wheels? Maybe a nice mid-size wheel between the giant one and the current medium one.

Awesome mod pack. Absolutely love making rovers with it. Suggestion:

1x1/2x1 Ion Engine and Xenon tanks

I also want ion engines, and 1 by 1 fuel tanks.

Btw, i found a bug with radial attachment of the 1 by 2 fuel/ox tanks.

I also want ion engines, and 1 by 1 fuel tanks.

Btw, i found a bug with radial attachment of the 1 by 2 fuel/ox tanks.

If you look back a couple of pages you should find a link where I made a couple of stand-in fuel tanks using the walkway hub model.

Really it is not hard, you just play with the config a little to tell it that it should have "this fuel" in "this amount" and the game takes care of it. 5 lines or so, with a couple of other minor changes like the parts name.
one of the best models i've seen, looks like I'm about to delete some other mods to make way for this!(to avoid crashing!)
